body.p: To His Excellency B Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Your Petitioner John D Mannen a Citizen of Kentucky and resident within the County of Warren for the last Fifty four years, respectfully represents, that at the May election 1859 he was duly & legally elected a Justice of the Peace in and for the County of Warren and held, and to the best of his ability discharged the duties of his office until about the 30th of March last. That he was tendered & accepted the office of Post Master at Graham, -- a country place, in his immediate vicenity. That he did this for the convenience of his neighbors, there being no person near who could so conveniently discharge its duties. In a pecuniary point of view the office was worthless, not more than one or two letters being received at it, on an average, per week. He accepted it, ignorant of the fact that there was any legal incompatability in his office of Justice of the Peace and that of Postmaster under the Federal Government that the Post office at Graham was discontinued in December last, a short time after it was established and he no longer holds the position of Post Master there. Having learnd that the two offices of Justice of the Peace & Post Master were incompatable, and that doubts are entertained as to the validity & legality of any act & judgments he may do or render as a Justice
he has resigned that office. and now respectfully solicits & prays Yr Excellency to re appoint him, to fill the vacancy thus occasioned during the remainder of the term for which he was elected ^or until the next general election^. There are from three to Four Hundred judgments in his office yet unsatisfied. and your Excy will at once percieve that his re appointment will be both a matter of great convenience to his district as well as of no small benefit to himself. All of which is most respectfully submitted by

Yr Excy obt sert
J D Mannen

Commonwealth of Kentucky
Warren County Sct

This day John D Mannen personally appeared before the undersigned, Judge of the Warren County Court and made oath that the facts related in the above Petition are true. Given under my hand this 6th August 1861.
W A Payne J W Co C
The undersigned respectfully & earnestly unite in the prayer of J D Mannen in his preceeding Petition
